comment: The only (unital) ring with a base set consisting of one element is the zero ring (at least if its operations are internal binary operations). Note: The assumption ` R e. Ring ` could be weakened if a definition of a non-unital ring ("Rng") was available (it would be sufficient that the multiplication is closed). (Contributed by FL, 13-Feb-2010.) (Revised by AV, 25-Jan-2020.) (Proof shortened by AV, 7-Feb-2020.)
